adjective.description: Holding or constituting a purely formal position or title without any real authority.
examples: the queen is titular head of the Church of England

adjective.description: Denoting a person or thing from whom or which the name of an artistic work or similar is taken.
Denoting any of the parish churches in Rome to which cardinals are formally appointed.
examples: the priests of the titular churches

origin: Late 16th century (in the sense existing only in name): from French titulaire or modern Latin titularis, from titulus (see title).
